intro: Ptilostephium, commonly known as the featherstep or false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are native to Australia and are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and yellowish or brownish flowers. Ptilostephium species typically grow in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. They have fibrous roots and produce small, capsule-like fruits that disperse seeds via wind. The genus is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in disturbed areas.
